org.mxupdate.update.util
Class JPOCaller_mxJPO

java.lang.Object
  org.mxupdate.update.util.JPOCaller_mxJPO

public class JPOCaller_mxJPO
extends Object

The class could be executed within the TCL update to call the original JPO update instance. To use this feature, the JPO update class must be defined from AbstractPropertyObject_mxJPO. In the derived class method AbstractPropertyObject_mxJPO.jpoCallExecute(ParameterCache_mxJPO, String...) must be overwritten.

Version:
$Id: JPOCaller_mxJPO.java 465 2009-07-12 19:46:26Z tim.moxter $
Author:
Tim Moxter

ENV_CLASS_NAME

private static final String ENV_CLASS_NAME
Prefix for the name of the global environment variable to define the name of the class which must be defined to call from MQL. The global environment variable gets a prefix of the MX session id.

See Also:
defineInstance(ParameterCache_mxJPO, AbstractPropertyObject_mxJPO), undefineInstance(ParameterCache_mxJPO), mxMain(Context, String[]), Constant Field Values

Method Detail

defineInstance

public static void defineInstance(ParameterCache_mxJPO _paramCache,
                                  AbstractPropertyObject_mxJPO _instance)
                           throws matrix.util.MatrixException
Defines given _instance and _paramCache which will be called within a TCL program. The name of this JPO is also stored in a global environment variable so that the instance and parameter cache could be evaluated in all cases.

Parameters:
_paramCache - parameter cache with MX context
_instance - new instance
Throws:
matrix.util.MatrixException - if global environment variable which defines the instance could not be defined (MQL call failed)
See Also:
PARAM_CACHE, CALLER_INSTANCE, ENV_CLASS_NAME, mxMain(Context, String[])

undefineInstance

public static void undefineInstance(ParameterCache_mxJPO _paramCache)
                             throws matrix.util.MatrixException
Removes from current MX session context the instance which could be called.

Parameters:
_paramCache - parameter cache with MX context
Throws:
matrix.util.MatrixException - if the global environment variable which defines the instance could not be removed (MQL call failed)
See Also:
PARAM_CACHE, CALLER_INSTANCE, ENV_CLASS_NAME

mxMain

public static void mxMain(matrix.db.Context _context,
                          String[] _args)
                   throws Exception

The method calls the original instance stored depending on the matrix session id. If for the current MX session id no instance of no parameter cache defined, errors are thrown.

In some cases (especially if MxUpdate is installed the first time) it could be that CALLER_INSTANCE and PARAM_CACHE set from defineInstance(ParameterCache_mxJPO, AbstractPropertyObject_mxJPO) within another JPO class than the class called for this method. In this case MX makes an automatically compile of the class. But this means also that the caller instance and the parameter cache could not be accessed directly. Instead the original JPO class which is used when the instance was defined is used (via Java reflection).

Parameters:
_context - context for this request
_args - list of arguments
Throws:
Exception - if execution fails
See Also:
PARAM_CACHE, CALLER_INSTANCE, ENV_CLASS_NAME, defineInstance(ParameterCache_mxJPO, AbstractPropertyObject_mxJPO)
